column4: is there any reason why i can ping ip from remotepc - otherpc, but if i goto http://ip from the remotepc it times out, yet http://ip on the localpc works fine
-> can you ping from remote to localpc?
yeah i can ping
-> can you ping from remote to localpc? but what is the result?
-> also try telnet 80  from remote to localpc
i can ping 192.... from remote to local,and get replies
got any ideas?
-> from your local, can you do  http://localhost  ?
yeah local works fine
-> your local has firewall activated?
says Firewall not loaded
-> verify with   sudo iptables -vL
-> and what are the os on  both ends?
both are ubuntu
-> verify with   sudo iptables -vL   what does this tells you,  post the results please
http://pastebin.com/d5ae8ebc4
-> you noticed your default policy is DROP ?  this could prevent your remote host getting into your localhost port 80
ahh i dont really understand much abotu that, can it be changed?
-> and also whatever tool you were using telling you Firewall is not loaded.. its giving you false info, you have firewall active all the time, and yours happen to have rules active right now
oh, so what can i do? i used "ufw status"
-> iptables are complex, there are front ends like ufw and such.. for atutorial see http://www.linuxexposed.com/content/view/107/
-> what you can do is a tutorial on iptables
hmm, allowed port 80 in iptables, yet still times out
